Show HN: A Comprehensive Digital Sales Room Platform for B2B Sales Teams
text:
Hi HN, We are building a digital sales room platform for B2B Sales Teams and would love to get this community in our early access list.

Some Context: If you are selling to B2B / Enterprise, you will be able to relate to some of these challenges:

1. The prospect needs a product presentation - which one should you send?? 2. Comments from prospects like: “We are reviewing internally” - well, are they really reviewing?? 3. Questions you ask yourselves like: "When and how should I follow up with this deal?”; “Is this deal going to convert this quarter?”

…and so much more uncertainty.

We’ve felt these challenges ourselves and thus decided to build Dealintent - an exciting product to help B2B sales teams identify, engage, and convert high-intent buyers while making the decision-making process easier for the buyers. With our product Dealintent, sales teams can use AI powered personality insights to uncover their buyers’ persona, quickly consolidate and share personalized content, and add stakeholders in digital sales rooms, streamlining the sales process and increasing efficiency.

If you’ve like to check out a quick walkthrough, you can simply watch the demo here: https://vimeo.com/788566472

We are currently running an early access campaign and giving out a 50% off on both our solo and team plans (in addition to a few more exciting offers to our early set of users). Click here to sign up for our early access campaign - https://www.dealintent.com/early-access?utm_source=HN&utm_medium=HN_post&utm_campaign=HN_Early_Access

We are also hoping that some of you might have inputs and suggestions, so please send them our way. If you have any questions, please do let us know as well - we'll gladly answer as best as we can. Look forward to it HN!

Show HN: Makejinja: Automatically generate complex Home Assistant configurations
text:
makejinja can be used to automatically generate files from Jinja templates. This allows you to load variables from external files or create repeating patterns via loops. A very interesting use case for this tool is generating config files for Home Assistant: Using the same language that the built-in templates use, you can greatly simplify your configuration. When creating for example dashboards, it allows you to create a view for each room based on a single common template, dramatically reducing the maintenance overhead of complex dashboards. I originally developed this for my smarthome setup, but thought it may be useful for others as well!

A concrete example for Home Assistant can be found in the tests directory: https://github.com/mirkolenz/makejinja/blob/main/tests/data

For more information like detailed features or installation/usage instructions, please visit the GitHub repo.

is Chrome recording keyboard inputs and passing them to YouTube?
text:
Three times over the last month a striking coincidence.

I use Chrome as my browser. Google owns both Chrome and YouTube.

I can't remember the first two incidents any more, but they were on the same scale as the third incident.

The third incident: two days ago I asked ChatGPT to give me the 600 most important words in Spanish. Today, YouTube has recommended me a video titled "100 most important words in Spanish". In at least the last three months, I have not asked YouTube for a Spanish-language-learning related video.

Ask HN: What will be the most valuable technology skills in future?
text:
Young person, a bit lost, struggling to get anywhere. Not really qualified for any work or able to afford degree. Had to drop out of college and have a year long unexplainable work gap after mental health decline. Have a generalized knowledge in tech from linux use, tinkering with networks and have a programming admiration but no idea how to translate this to a marketable skill set.

If you were in early 20s and had 6months to a year to try and get on track. what would you focus on? IT, programming, cloud, what is the optimal vehicle and will be valuable in 5 years? Is IT or programming safer bet?
